page.title: 02Ecology of Borgue
page.content: This area is under the influence of the Gulf Stream drift, which means that the climate is very mild. Snow rarely falls, and if it does, it does not last for more than a day or two. The prevailing winds are south-westerlies which bring with them moderate falls of rain. When other parts of the region may be having quite severe weather, we have been known to be basking in sunshine. This mild climate is most conducive to pasture land which makes up 90% of this block. The land is well drained by small streams, all having their outlet at the coast nearby, and once providing the scattered population with their household water supply. The area is well serviced with scondary roads. Cart tracks and footpaths link most of the farms.
